You could appeal to someone's ego and sense of superiority by giving them the impression that you'll only participate if they do, or you could pressure them into coercing them into something that they are uncomfortable with. You can also create an atmosphere where compromise is not an option, as a lack of alternatives might make somebody reluctantly agree. It is important to maintain a level of guilt-inducing deception and emotional intimidation while employing these tactics, as without it they are significantly less effective.
093
column3: Threatening someone to get them to behave the way you want them to is not effective and can cause lasting damage.
